info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 1:31PM MST until December 17 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Very cold wind chills expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with isolated totals to 4 inches, especially closer to the North Dakota border. Wind chill values of 30 to 35 below zero are expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Montana. * WHEN...Cold wind chills from 11 PM this evening to 8 PM MST Friday. The main accumulating snow is expected from around 5 AM Friday morning through the late afternoon hours. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
